User Login Activity

The User Login Activity section shows who has logged into Unit Master, when they logged in and other basic details that help administrators monitor access to the system.

What is User Login Activity?

The User Login Activity page provides a history of login events for all users. It is mainly used by system administrators and auditors to review how the system is being accessed.

By checking this page regularly, administrators can identify unusual patterns, such as logins at unexpected times or from unexpected accounts, and follow up if needed.

View User Login Activity

The User Login Activity section tracks login details for users. It records key information such as:

  • Login date and time When the user accessed the system.
  • User name or ID Which user account logged in.
  • Additional details Sometimes the location or device used, depending on configuration.

This log helps administrators monitor access, detect unusual activity and support audits or security reviews. It is a useful tool for both security and compliance.
